banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: The radical, revolutionary resilience of Black joy
videoData.socialTitle: The radical, revolutionary resilience of Black joy

recommendations.blurb: More resources curated by Miracle Jones

recItems.blurb: A collection of stories about how unapologetically Black women navigate church, identity and sexuality.
recItems.headline: *The Secret Lives of Church Ladies*
recItems.label: READ_BOOK
recItems.note:
Deesha Philyaw
West Virginia University Press, 2020

recItems.blurb: A review of how Black women impact culture, society and feminism through a variety of. mediums including digital spaces to course correct and raise awareness and consciousness.
recItems.headline: *Reclaiming Our Space: How Black Feminists Are Changing the World from the Tweets to the Streets*
recItems.label: READ_BOOK

recItems.blurb: A Collection ofThis collection of poetry, prose and art by 19 Black womxn and femmes in Pittsburgh exploring love, joy, identity and more.
recItems.headline: *TENDER a literary anthology and book of spells: evidence*
recItems.label: READ_BOOK
recItems.note:
Mequitta Ahuja, Melanie Dione, vanessa german, et al.
1Hood

recItems.headline: "Why are so many Black women talking about leaving Pittsburgh?"
recItems.label: READ_ARTICLE

recItems.headline: "Pittsburgh-Based Photographer Plumbs The 'Infinite Essence' Of Black Bodies"
recItems.label: READ_ARTICLE

nodes.whoTheyAre: Miracle Jones works in the Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania area to advocate for equity along the intersections of gender, race and class.
nodes.whyListen:
Miracle Jones's work focuses on implementing abolition-based principles and transformative justice through writing, policy and advocacy. 

She also enjoys great books, delicious foods and local music.

videoData.description: In the face of trauma, happiness is resilience: a revolutionary act of thriving despite all odds, rather than wilting or surrendering. Community organizer and activist Miracle Jones offers a heart-to-heart meditation on the role of joy as a form of radical resistance, survival and protection for Black folks in the US and across the world. A warm reminder to embrace the guiding light of hope in the presence of darkness.
videoData.socialDescription: In the face of trauma, happiness is resilience: a revolutionary act of thriving despite all odds, rather than wilting or surrendering. Community organizer and activist Miracle Jones offers a heart-to-heart meditation on the role of joy as a form of radical resistance, survival and protection for Black folks in the US and across the world. A warm reminder to embrace the guiding light of hope in the presence of darkness.

footnotes.annotation:
> “Do you know how radical and revolutionary joy is as a Black woman living in the worst city for black women?”

The city of Pittsburgh’s Gender Equity Commission released [a white paper in 2019](https://apps.pittsburghpa.gov/redtail/images/7109_Pittsburgh%27s_Inequality_Across_Gender_and_Race_09_18_19.pdf) indicating that Pittsburgh is the worst city for Black women to live in by just about every metric.
